text: I chased upstairs, taking the steps two at a time. The corridor was cold, like no one had lived there for years. Her door was ajar, a thin line of light leaking through the crack.
"Who are you, really? How did you know the key was under the carpet? Do you know me?"
A cold voice came from inside the room. "Don’t come in."
"The more you ask, the more dangerous it becomes for you."
She pushed the door open just a little. I could only see her standing in the shadows, her face pale, dark circles heavy beneath her eyes.
"At least tell me—why won’t you do anything?"
Her tone wasn’t harsh, but it left no room for argument. This wasn’t a discussion—it was an order.
"I’ll be staying here tonight. Don’t come back up."
The door shut with a sharp click. I stood alone in the corridor, the bruise on my face throbbing, my chest feeling even tighter.
Grinding my teeth, I turned and went downstairs. She had driven me away completely, like she was afraid one more word from me would cause trouble.
